citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, a gray short-tailed opossum had regional hair loss covering the hind end of unknown duration. The
licensee had not contacted the attending veterinarian regarding this change in health status and sought to improve the
condition with a change in diet. Not communicating changes in health status of animals to attending veterinarians can
result in prolonged illness in animals. Timely and direct communication with the attending veterinarian regarding changes
in the health and behavior status of animals is required.
Correct by 1 May 2023 by alerting the attending veterinarian of the gray short-tailed opossum’s health status.

A written contingency plan was not available at time of inspection. Contingency plans help prepare facilities on how to
provide humane handling of animals during emergent events. The licensee must develop a complete contingency plan
tailored to the facility and animals on hand. All personnel must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this plan
and the facility must maintain documentation thereof. The contingency plan must be reviewed and documented annually.
Correct by 22 May 2023 by developing a contingency plan.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
